title: Why would a Japanese guy ask for my family name? - Quora

author_info.name: Swarnali Chatterjee Yokota
author_info.href: /profile/横田-チャタジー-スワルナーリ-Swarnali-Chatterjee-Yokota

response.answer_text: Because in Japan everyone is called by their family name not first name. Your first name is used only by very close friends or family. That's why you were asked for your family name. Calling people by their first name is rude.
